definition: to quote a price/seller's first offer

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Azia still asked for nine hundred of gold for his horse.
sentences.chinese: 阿齊茲依然爲他的馬開價九百塊金幣。

sentences.english: Mister want, I can only offer eight thousand, Mister smile.
sentences.chinese: 老總想要，我卻只開價八千，老總會心一笑。

sentences.english: Our prices compare most favorably with quotations you can get from other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 我們的價格比其他製造商開價優惠得多。

sentences.english: They quoted 756 dollars for the single New York—London fare.
sentences.chinese: 他們對紐約到倫敦的單程機票開價是756美元。

sentences.english: The Stamford Bridge club are expecting an improved third bid for the player from Manchester City.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦福橋俱樂部正等待曼城第三次更高的開價。

sentences.english: Liverpool have today agreed a fee for the sale of Emiliano Insua to Serie A side Fiorentina.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦今天宣佈同意了紫百合爲小因的轉會開價。

sentences.english: Relax price control, enliven the market.
They offered me the computer for 2000 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 他們開價2000元把那部電腦賣給我。
忒彌斯團隊開價2百萬美元。

definition: to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
